turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: It was a pretty long message, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What exactly do you mean?

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: The message you left.

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: By the way Davis, how is Cynthia? You're still seeing her, right?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: But wait, Harold, what do you mean?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Carnes? Wait.

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: Davis. I'm not one to bad-mouth anyone, your joke was amusing. But come on, man, you had one fatal flaw: Bateman's such a dork, such a boring, spineless lightweight, that I couldn't fully appreciate it. I wasn't fooled for a second. Now, if you'd said Price, or McDermott...Otherwise, it was amusing. Now, let's have lunch or dinner or something. Hilarious, Davis. A killer.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What are you talking about? Bateman is what?

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: Oh Christ. He can barely pick up an escort girl, let alone...what was it you said he did to her?

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I really must...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Wait. Stop. You don't seem to understand. You're not really comprehending any of this. I killed him. I did it, Carnes. I'm Patrick Bateman. I chopped Owen's fucking head off. I tortured dozens of girls. The whole message I left on your machine was true.

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: Excuse me. I really must he going.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No! Listen, don't you know who I am? I'm not Davis, I'm Patrick Bateman! I talk to you on the phone all the time! Don't you recognize me? You're my lawyer.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Now, Carnes, listen to me. Listen very, very carefully. I killed Paul Owen and I liked it. I can't make myself any clearer

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: But that's simply not possible. And I don't find this funny anymore.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: It never was supposed to he! Why isn't it possible?

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: It's just not.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Why not, you stupid bastard?

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: Because I had dinner with Paul Owen twice in London...just ten days ago.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, you...didn't?

turns.speaker: CARNES
turns.text: Now, if you'll excuse me.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Patrick, thanks so much for looking after Courtney. Dorsia, how impressive! How on earth did you get a reservation there?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Lucky, I guess.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: That's a wonderful jacket. Let me guess, Valentino Couture?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: It looks so soft.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Your compliment was sufficient Luis.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Patrick? Is that you?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, Luis. It's not me. You're mistaken.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: This is Gwendolyn Ichiban. This is my very good friend Patrick Bateman. Where are you going? We're going to Nell's. Gwendolyn's father's buying it.  Where did you get your overnight bag?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Commes des Garcon.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Call me please, Patrick.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jesus lives, Luis.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What...is...it?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I've gotta...I've gotta...return some videotapes.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Patrick?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What? CARRUTHERS  I'll call you.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Van Patten looks puffy. Has he stopped working out?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: It looks that way, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: That's Paul Owen.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: That's not Paul Owen. Paul Owen's on the other side of the room. Over there.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: There's this theory out now that if you can catch the AIDS virus through having sex with someone who is infected, then you can also catch anything-Alzheimer's, muscular dystrophy, hemophilia, leukemia, diabetes, dyslexia, for Christ's sake-you can get dyslexia from pussy-

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'm not sure, guy, but I don't think dyslexia is a virus.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Oh, who knows? They don't know that. Prove it.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Jeez. That's not a helluva lot, is it?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Maybe it's just the light.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Is he fucking selling it by the milligram?  Oh my God...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: It's a fucking milligram of Sweet'n Low!

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: It's definitely weak but I have a feeling if we do enough of it we'll be okay.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I want to get high off this; Bateman, not sprinkle it on my fucking All-Bran.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Calm down. Let's do it anyway

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I guess you're right...  THAT IS, IF THE FAGGOT IN THE NEXT STALL THINKS IT'S OKAY!

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh come on. Price. There are a lot more important problems than Sri Lanka to worry about. Sure our foreign policy is important, but there are more pressing problems at hand.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, we have to end apartheid for one. And slow down the nuclear arms race, stop terrorism and world hunger. But we can't ignore our social needs. either We have to stop people from abusing the welfare system. We have to provide food and shelter for the homeless and oppose racial discrimination and promote civil rights while also promoting equal rights for women but change the abortion laws to protect the right to life yet still somehow maintain women's freedom of choice.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: What's that, a gram?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: New card. What do you think?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I can't believe that Price prefers McDermott's card to mine.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: But wait. You ain't seen nothin' yet.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Raised lettering, pale nimbus white...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Impressive. Very nice. Let's see Paul Owen's card.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Yes, Caron's right. Gorbachev's not downstairs. He's at Tunnel.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Ask me a question.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I'm leaving. I'm getting out.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Leaving what?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: This.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Don't, I'll drink it.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Listen to me, Patrick. I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Where to? Are you going to go get a gram?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I'm leaving! I...am...leaving!

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Don't tell me...merchant banking?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: No, you dumb son of a bitch. I'm serious. I'm disappearing.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Where to? Morgan Stanley? Rehab? What?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: And Bateman, what are YOU SO fucking zany about?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'm just a happy camper. Rockin' and a-rollin'. VAN PATTEN  Rehab's done wonders for you, pal. Working for UNICEF now?

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Dorsia.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Umm...yes...I know it's a little late but is it possible to reserve a table for two at eight or eight-thirty perhaps?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Marcus Halberstam. For two at eight?

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Your friend has already been seated. Follow me, Mr. Halberstam.

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: Dorsia, yes?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yes, can you take two tonight, oh, let's say at nine o'clock?

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: We are totally booked.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh really? That's great.

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: I said we are totally booked.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Two at nine? Perfect.

turns.speaker: MAITRE D'
turns.text: There are no tables available tonight. The waiting list is also totally booked.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: See you then.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Late?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Aerobics class. Sorry. Any messages?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Ricky Hendricks has to cancel today. He didn't say what he was canceling or why.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I occasionally box with Ricky at the Harvard Club. Anyone else?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: And...Spencer wants to meet you for a drink at Fluties Pier 17.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: After six.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Negative. Cancel it.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh? And what should I say?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Just...say...no.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Just say no?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Okay, Jean. I need reservations for three at Camols at twelve-thirty, and if not there, try Crayons. All right?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh, something. . romantic?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, silly. Forget it. I'll make them. Thanks.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No. No. Be a doll and just get me a Perrier, okay?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: You look nice today.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Is that the Ransom file? Thanks. Don't wear that outfit again.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Ummm...what? I didn't hear you.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I said "Do not wear that outfit again." Wear a dress. A skirt or something.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: You don't like this, I take it?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Come on, you're prettier than that.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Thanks, Patrick.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Ye-es, Je-an?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick, a Mr. Donald KIMBALL is here to see you.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Detective Donald KIMBALL?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Tell him I'm at lunch.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick, I think he knows you're here. It's only ten-thirty.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Can you bring Mr...

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Yes, Patrick?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Bring us an ashtray for Mr. KIMBALL, please. She whisks in with a crystal ashtray as they sit in silence.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jean?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Yes, Patrick?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Would you like to accompany me to dinner?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: That is...if you're not doing anything.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh no. I have no plans.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, isn't this a coincidence.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Anywhere you want?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Let's not think about what I want. How about anywhere you want.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh Patrick, I can't make this decision.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, come on. Anywhere you want.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh, I can't.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Come on. Where do you want to go? Anywhere you want. Just say it. I can get us in anywhere.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Soooo...Dorsia is where Jean wants to go...

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. No, we'll go anywhere you want.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Dorsia is...fine.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yes? You're dressed...okay.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: You didn't give them a name.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: They know me.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jean? Sorbet?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Thanks, Patrick. I'd love some.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Want a bite?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'm on a diet. But thank you.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: You don't need to lose any weight. You're kidding, right? You look great. Very fit.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: You can always he thinner. Look...better.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Well, maybe we shouldn't go out to dinner. I don't want to ruin your willpower.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No. It's all right. I'm not very good at controlling it anyway.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: And don't tell me you enjoy working with children, okay?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Well, I'd like to travel. And maybe go back to school, but I really don't know...I'm at a point in my life where there seems lo be a lot of possibilities, but I'm so... I don't know...unsure.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Do you have a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: No, not really.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Interesting.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Are you seeing anyone? I mean, seriously?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Maybe. I don't know Not really. Bateman opens up a cupboard where there are a lot of very Bateman opens a cupboard where there are a lot of neatly ordered weapons - an ax, a rifle, a chain saw, duct tape, twine and a nail gun.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jean, do you feel...fulfilled? I mean, in your life?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Well, I guess I do. For a long time I was too focused on my work, I think, but now I've really begun to think about changing myself, you know, developing, and...growing.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Growing. I'm glad you said that.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Did you know that Ted Bundy's first dog, a collie, was named Lassie? Had you heard this?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Who's Ted Bundy?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh. Uh, tape. Duct tape. I...need it for... taping something. Bateman goes back to the cupboard for the nail gun.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick, have you ever wanted to make someone happy?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What...No! Put it in the carton.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jean? What?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Make someone happy-have you ever wanted to?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'm looking for...I guess you could say I just want to have a meaningful relationship with someone special.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Hmmmm.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yes. I don t think I can...control myself.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: I know I should go. I know I have a tendency to get involved with unavailable men, and...I mean, do you want me to go?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: If you stay, I think something bad will happen. I think I might hurt you.  You don't want to get hurt, do you?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: No. No, I guess not. I don't want to get bruised. You're right, I should go.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: And don't forget you have a breakfast meeting with Frederick Bennet and Charles Rust at '21.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Thanks. It slipped my mind completely.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick Bateman's office.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jean? Hello? Jean?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick? Is that you?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Hello? Jean, I need help!

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Jean-I'm not-

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Craig McDermott called. He wants to meet you and David Van Patten and Tim Price at Harry's for drinks.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh God, what did you say, you dumb bitch?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Patrick? I can't hear you.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What are I doing?

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Where are you? Patrick, what's wrong?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I don't think I'm gonna make it, Jean.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: ...to the office this afternoon.

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Just...say...no!

turns.speaker: JEAN
turns.text: What is it, Patrick? Are you alright?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Stop sounding so Fucking sad! Jesus!

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: So, what do you do?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What do you think I do?

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: A model? An actor?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No. Flattering, but no.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I m into, well, murders and executions mostly.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Welt...it depends, why?

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: Well, most guys I know who work in mergers and acquisitions don't really like it.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh really? DAISY He said...  He said you gave him bad vibes.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: That's...that's too bad.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: You think I'm dumb, don't you?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: You think I'm dumb. You think all models are dumb.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No. I really don't.

turns.speaker: DAISY
turns.text: That's okay. I don't mind. There's something sweet about you.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Hi, Patrick. I thought that was you.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Hello

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Isn't it ridiculous? Coming all the way up here, but you know. They really are the best.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Then why can't they get these stains out? I mean can you talk to these people or something? I'm not getting anywhere.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, I mean, um, it s really...Bosco. You know, like... like a Dove Bar. It's a Dove Bar...Hershey's Syrup?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Oh yeah. Oh I get it. Fun with chocolate.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Listen, if you could talk to them  I would really appreciate it. I'm really late. I have a lunch appointment at Hubert's in fifteen minutes.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Hubert's? Oh really? It moved uptown, right?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yeah, well, oh boy, listen, I've got to go. Thank you, uh... Victoria?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Maybe we could have lunch one day next week? You know, I'm downtown near Wall Street quite often.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh, I don't know, Victoria. I'm at work all the time.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Well, what about, oh, you know, maybe a Saturday?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Next Saturday?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh, can't, I'm afraid. Matinée of Les Miserables. Listen, I've really got to go. I'll-Oh...Christ...I'll call you.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Okay. Do.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What do you mean, she was a hot number.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: If you had an American Express card she'd give you a blowjob.  Listen, this girl worked in a tanning salon, need I say more?...What do you do?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: She's my...cousin.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Uh huh?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: She's from...France.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Elizabeth, it's three in the morning.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: He's a goddamn drug dealer! These are his peak hours.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Don't tell him you're here.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Why would I?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: This tastes weird.  Harley? It's me. I need your services. Translate that anyway you'd like. I'm at-

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: You're at Paul Owen s.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Paul Owen.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I want the number, idiot.  Anyway, I'm at Paul Norman's and I'll try you later and if I don't see you at Canal Bar tomorrow night I'm going to sic my hairdresser on you.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Did you know that guy who disappeared? Didn't he work at Pierce & Pierce, too? Was he a friend of yours?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Do you have any coke? Or Halcyon? I'd take a Halcyon.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Listen, I would just like to see...the two of you...get it on. What's wrong with that? It's totally disease-free.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Patrick, you re a lunatic.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Come on. Don't you find Christie attractive?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Let's not get lewd.  I'm in no mood to have a lewd conversation.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Come on. I think it would be a turn-on.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Does he do this all the time?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Are you telling me you've never gotten it on with a girl?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: No! I'm not a lesbian. Why do you think I'd be into that?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, you went to Sarah Lawrence for one thing.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Those are Sarah Lawrence guys, Patrick. You're making me feel weird.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Did you know that Whitney Houston's debut LP called simply Whitney Houston had four number-one singles on it? Did you know that, Christie? Whitney's voice leaps across so many boundaries and is so versatile-though she's mainly a jazz singer-that it's hard to take in the album on a first listening.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You actually listen to Whitney Houston? You actually have a Whitney Houston CD? More than one?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Listen, John, I've got to go. T Boone Pickens just walked in...  Just joking...  No don't tip the owner of the salon. Okay, John, right, got it.  Sorry about that.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No, I'm sorry. I should've made an appointment.  Was that anything important?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh that? Just mulling over business problems. Examining opportunities...Exchanging rumors... Spreading gossip.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Hi. I'm Donald KIMBALL

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Hi. Pat Bateman. Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I'm sorry to barge in on you like this. but I was supposed to talk to Luis Carruthers and he wasn't in and...well, you're here, so...I know how busy you guys can get.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: So, what's the topic of discussion?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I've been hired by Meredith Powell to investigate the disappearance of Paul Owen.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: You're not with the FBI or anything, are you?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Nothing like that. I'm just a private investigator.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Ah, I see...Yes. Paul's disappearance...Yes.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: So it's nothing that official. I just have some basic questions. About Paul Owen. About yourself-

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Coffee?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No. I'm okay.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Perrier? San Pellegrino?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No, I'm okay.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: KIMBALL.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Mr. Kimball a bottle of San Pelle-

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Oh no, I'm okay.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: It's no problem

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, what's the topic of discussion?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: The disappearance of Paul Owen.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh right. Well, I haven't heard anything about the disappearance or anything...  Not on "Page Six" at least.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I think his family wants this kept quiet.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Understandable.  Lime?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No, really. I'm okay.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: You sure? I can always get you a lime.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Just some preliminary questions that I need for my own files, okay?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Twenty-six. I'll be twenty-seven in October.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Where did you go to school?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Harvard. The Harvard Business School.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Your address?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Fifty-five West Eighty-First Street. The American Gardens Building.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Nice. Very nice.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Pardon me, but are you okay?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Who do you ask?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: You seem...nervous.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Bad habit.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I know. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Would you rather I not smoke?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, I guess it's okay.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: What can you tell me about Paul Owen?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: How well did you know him?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'm...at a loss. He was part of that whole...Yale thing, you know.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Yale thing?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yeah...Yale thing.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: What do you mean...Yale thing?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: So...there's nothing you can tell me about Paul Owen?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: He led what I suppose was an orderly life. He... ate a balanced diet.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: What kind of man was he? Besides...  the information you've just given.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I hope I'm not being cross-examined here.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Do you feel that way?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No. Not really.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Where did Paul hang out?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Hang...out?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Yeah. You know...hang out.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Let me think. The Newport. Harry's. Fluties. Endochine. Nell's. Comell Club. The New York Yacht Club. The regular places.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: He had a yacht?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, he just hung out there.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: And where did he go to school?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Don't you know this?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I just wanted to know if you know. BATEMAN Before Yale? If I remember correctly, Saint Paul's... Listen, I just...I just want to help.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Anything else you can tell me about Owen?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: We were both seven in 1969.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: So was I.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Do you have any witnesses or fingerprints?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Well, there's a message on his answering machine saying he went to London.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, maybe he did, huh?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: His girlfriend doesn't think so.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: But...has anyone seen him in London?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Actually, yes.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Hmmm.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Well, I've had a hard time getting an actual verification. A Stephen Hughes says he saw him at a restaurant there, but I checked it out and what happened is, he mistook a Hubert Ainsworth for Paul, so...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Was he involved at all , do you think, in occultism or Satan worship?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I know it sounds like a lame question, but in New Jersey I know this sounds like a lame question, but last month-I don't know if you've heard about this, but a young stockbroker was recently arrested and charged with murdering a young Chicano girl and performing voodoo rituals with various body parts-

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yikes! No. Paul wasn't into that. He followed a balanced diet and-

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Yeah, I know, and was into that whole Yale thing.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Have you consulted a psychic?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Had his apartment been burglarized?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No, it actually hadn't. Toiletries were missing. A suit was gone. So was some luggage. That's it.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I mean no one's dealing with the homicide squad yet or anything, right?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No, not yet. As I said, we're not sure. But... basically no one has seen or heard anything.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: That's so typical, isn't it?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: It's just strange.  One day someone's walking around, going to work, alive, and then...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: People just...disappear.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: The earth just opens up and swallows people.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Eerie. Really eerie.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: You'll have to excuse me. I have a lunch meeting with Cliff Huxtable at Four Seasons in twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Isn't the Four Seasons a little far uptown? I mean aren't you going to be late?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Uh, no. There's one...down here.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Oh really? I didn't know that.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Listen, if anything occurs to you, any information at all...

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Absolutely, I'm 100% with you.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Great, and thanks for your, uh, time, Mr. Bateman.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Detective Kendall...uh Campbell? KIMBALL Kimball.  Call me Don.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Don.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: So...you hang out here a lot?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Uh, yes...I mean...whenever necessary. You know.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: How's the investigation going? Taken anyone in for "formal questioning?"

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: 0h no. Informal conversations, mostly. What's that, Stoli?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yeah. No Finlandia, as usual. Fucking dump.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Too true. You know, Bateman-people tend to reveal so much more about themselves when they're in a relaxed setting, don't you think?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I mean they want to get caught.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Dan, great to see you again. Like I said, you need anything at all, I'm your man. I don't envy your job. I mean Owen was a...complex man.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I actually came to see Timothy Price, but he's taken a leave of absence.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yeah, gone into rehab. Shame.  Is he a suspect?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Do you remember where you were on the night of Paul's disappearance?  Which was on the twentieth of December?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: God...I guess...I was probably returning videotapes.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I had a date with a girl named Veronica.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Wait. That's not what I've got.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: That's not the information I've received.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well...I...Wait...What information have you received?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Let's see...  That you were with-

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, I could he wrong.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Well...When was the last time you were with Paul Owen?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: We had...gone to a new musical called...Oh Africa, Brave Africa. It was...a laugh riot...and that's about it. I think we had dinner at Orso's. No, Petaluma. No, Orso's. The...last time I physically saw him was...at an automated teller. I can't remember which...just one that was near, um, Nell's.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Well, thank you, Mr. Bateman.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Patrick, please. I hope I've been informative. Long day-a bit scattered.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Listen, I'm a little spent for now but how about lunch in a week or so when I've sorted out all this information?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Great, yes, I'd like that.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: And if you could try and pin down where you were the night of Owen's disappearance, it would make my job a lot easier.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Absolutely. I'm with you on that one.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Never. I mean...I don't really like... singers.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Not a big music fan, eh?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: No, I like music. Just-they're-Huey's too... black sounding. For me.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Well, to each his own. So-lunch, Thursday? I'll call your secretary about reservations.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'll be there.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: No hash browns?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Not in the mood, I guess.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: But...everyone orders the hash browns here. I mean- it's-have you been here before?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Yes, of course. The hash browns are delicious. I'm just...not... ordering them.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Suit yourself, I guess.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: So, the night he disappeared? Any new thoughts on what you did?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: I'm not really sure. I had a shower...and some sorbet?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I think maybe you've got your dates mixed up.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: But how? Where do you place Paul that night?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: According to his date book, and this was verified by his secretary, he had dinner with...Marcus Halberstam.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I've questioned him.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Marcus?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Yes. And he denies it. Though at first he couldn't be sure.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: But Marcus denied it?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Well, does Marcus have an alibi?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: He does? You're sure?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: I checked it out. It's clean.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh. KIMBALL Now where were you?

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Where was Marcus?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: He wasn't with Paul Owen.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: So who was he with?

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: He was at Atlantis with Craig McDermott, Frederick Dibble, Harry Newman, George Butner and   - you.

turns.speaker: BATEMAN
turns.text: Oh, right. Of course...We had wanted Paul Owen to come. But he said he had plans...I guess I had dinner with Victoria...the following night.

turns.speaker: KIMBALL
turns.text: Personally I think the guy went a little nutso. Split town for a while. Maybe he did go to London. Sightseeing. Drinking. Whatever. Anyway, I'm pretty sure he'll turn up sooner or later.  I mean, to think that one of his friends killed him, for no reason whatsoever would be too ridiculous. Isn't that right, Patrick?
